decks.notes: The main concept of this deck is to generate a high amount of mana through fast mana sources and rituals, then utilize cards like Infernal Tutor and Ad Nauseam to build up a critical mass of spells in a single turn. By chaining spells together, the deck aims to generate a large storm count and finish the game with Tendrils of Agony for a lethal amount of damage. The deck also includes disruption in the form of Duress, Thoughtseize, and counterspells to protect its combo pieces and disrupt the opponent's game plan.

Utilize lands to control the game and disrupt opponents' strategies while building up powerful land combos for victory. The deck focuses on utilizing lands like Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage to create a 20/20 flying indestructible Marit Lage token, while also utilizing cards like Wasteland and Rishadan Port to disrupt opponents' mana base. Life from the Loam and Exploration help to continuously recur lands and accelerate mana production, while Punishing Fire provides targeted removal. Gamble and Crop Rotation help to find key pieces for the land combos.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly assemble the Dark Depths combo, using cards like Crop Rotation and Thespian's Stage to create a 20/20 Marit Lage token. The deck also includes disruption through discard spells like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek, as well as removal like Abrupt Decay. Sylvan Library and Dark Confidant provide card advantage and consistency, while cards like Life from the Loam and Mox Diamond help with mana acceleration and fixing. The inclusion of utility lands like Bojuka Bog and Sejiri Steppe provide additional value and protection for the combo.

This Grixis Control deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan through a combination of counterspells, discard spells, and removal. It aims to control the board and outvalue the opponent with powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Liliana, the Last Hope. With a mix of card advantage engines like Baleful Strix and Snapcaster Mage, along with efficient removal spells like Fatal Push and Lightning Bolt, this deck is all about grinding out incremental advantage and overwhelming the opponent with efficient threats and disruption.

This Grixis Aggro deck focuses on quickly deploying threats like Delver of Secrets, Young Pyromancer, and True-Name Nemesis while disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Daze, Inquisition of Kozilek, and Thoughtseize. The deck also includes efficient removal options like Lightning Bolt and Dismember, as well as countermagic like Force of Will and Spell Pierce to protect its threats. Wasteland is used to disrupt the opponent's mana base, giving this deck a tempo advantage. Overall, the deck aims to apply pressure early and maintain control throughout the game.

The deck focuses on assembling a powerful board presence quickly by leveraging the synergy between various Elf creatures and mana-producing lands. It aims to generate massive amounts of mana using cards like Gaea's Cradle and Heritage Druid, while drawing through the deck with Glimpse of Nature. The key combo involves casting Natural Order to search for Craterhoof Behemoth and overwhelming the opponent with a massive attack. The deck also includes disruption like Reclamation Sage and Archon of Valor's Reach to control the board and protect the combo.

The deck focuses on aggressive gameplay, utilizing low-cost spells coupled with disruptive elements to control the board and put pressure on the opponent. Cards like Lightning Bolt and Delver of Secrets enable quick damage output, while counter spells like Force of Will and Daze provide protection. The inclusion of disruptive cards such as Thoughtseize and Wasteland aim to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also includes threats like True-Name Nemesis and Gurmag Angler, providing versatile win conditions. Overall, the deck aims to control the game tempo and secure victory through efficient aggression and disruption.

The main concept of this Merfolk aggro deck is to maximize tempo and disruption through an efficient creature base and disruptive spells. Utilizing cards like Spellstutter Sprite and Cursecatcher to counter key spells, combined with creatures like Harbinger of the Tides for tempo plays, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while applying pressure with creatures like Master of Waves and Silvergill Adept. Aether Vial allows for efficient creature deployment, while Grand Architect provides additional mana acceleration. With a carefully curated creature base and disruptive elements, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents quickly.

The Aggro-Death's Shadow Legacy deck focuses on disrupting opponents with discard spells like Thoughtseize and Hymn to Tourach, while also utilizing powerful creatures like Gurmag Angler and Death's Shadow to quickly deal damage. The deck also includes control elements like Force of Will and Daze to protect its threats. By efficiently using card selection with Ponder and Brainstorm, and applying pressure with Delver of Secrets and Street Wraith, the deck aims to take control of the game early on and overwhelm opponents with its aggressive strategy.

The deck focuses on using fast mana sources like Lotus Petal and Lion's Eye Diamond to generate mana quickly in order to cast a high storm count spell like Tendrils of Agony or Ad Nauseam to win the game. It includes a variety of cantrips like Brainstorm, Ponder, and Preordain to dig for combo pieces and disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Duress to protect the combo. The deck also includes efficient mana acceleration like Dark Ritual and Cabal Ritual, along with recursion spells like Past in Flames to generate a large storm count for a game-winning combo turn.

This deck aims to quickly cheat powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Emrakul, the Aeons Torn into play by using cards like Show and Tell, Sneak Attack, and Omniscience. It includes a lot of card manipulation and counter spells to protect these game-winning plays, while also providing efficient mana acceleration with cards like Lotus Petal and City of Traitors. The focus is on getting out big threats early and overwhelming the opponent with powerful creatures before they have a chance to establish their own game plan.

This deck focuses on using the combo of Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage to quickly create a 20/20 creature token that can win the game in just one attack. It has a toolbox of cards like Crop Rotation, Sylvan Scrying, and Life from the Loam to help assemble the combo pieces quickly. The deck also includes disruption in the form of Thoughtseize, Inquisition of Kozilek, and Abrupt Decay to control the game until it can assemble its combo. It aims to win the game swiftly and decisively through its powerful combo pieces.

The deck focuses on quickly generating mana and card advantage with Elves to facilitate a win condition of either casting Craterhoof Behemoth to overwhelm the opponent with high power creatures, or tutoring for and playing Archon of Valor's Reach to lock the opponent out of casting certain spells. Cards like Glimpse of Nature and Heritage Druid allow for explosive turns, while Natural Order and Green Sun's Zenith provide flexibility in finding key pieces. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a powerful board state and quickly close out the game.

The main concept of this Control - Stoneblade deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan while deploying efficient threats and card advantage. By utilizing counterspells like Force of Will, Daze, and Spell Pierce, alongside removal spells like Swords to Plowshares, the deck aims to protect its creatures and land critical blows with cards like Delver of Secrets and True-Name Nemesis. The inclusion of Stoneforge Mystic allows for the efficient tutor and deployment of powerful equipment like Batterskull and Umezawa's Jitte, providing additional threats and options to control the game.

This Eldrazi Aggro deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly and playing large, powerful Eldrazi creatures to overwhelm opponents. The deck includes cards like Ancient Tomb, Cloudpost, Grim Monolith, and Glimmerpost to accelerate mana production, allowing for early plays of creatures like Thought-Knot Seer and Reality Smasher. Chalice of the Void and Sorcerous Spyglass disrupt opponents, while Endbringer and Walking Ballista provide additional utility and removal. Emrakul, the Promised End and Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger serve as powerful finishers, sealing the game in the late stages. Karn, Scion of Urza provides card advantage and additional threats.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy through a combination of counter spells and hand disruption, while generating card advantage with Baleful Strix and Snapcaster Mage. It aims to stabilize the board with removal spells like Fatal Push and Kolaghan's Command before eventually winning the game with powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Liliana, the Last Hope. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the deck's color requirements, allowing for consistent casting of spells. Overall, the deck seeks to control the game and outvalue the opponent through efficient card selection and interaction.
